runs.comm: starts on a good length, around the line of middle and off, shapes back a fraction as Warner blocks from the crease
slightly shorter and on the legs, stays back and flicks the first run of the innings down to fine leg
in the channel, not doing much through the air or off the pitch, Finch gets a stride in and shoulders arms
goes a little wider and angles this in towards off stump, holds its line, defended on the front foot
beaten! Moral victory to Southee - whatever that counts for - as Finch is drawn into pushing at one in the corridor
testing line from Southee, Finch has not been in the pink for a few weeks now, hangs his bat out but once again manages to keep it inside the line
sends this down on a length outside off and Warner has a flash, zips past the edge, definitely some shape there
in the corridor, trying to draw Warner out, doesn't bother with the feet and throws the hands, another play and miss! Swinging for both of them
pitched up on the stumps, not quite a yorker, tucked into the leg side for a single

inswinger to Finch, played on to his front pad, it loops back to the bowler... got him! There's the first, New Zealand are amongst them! Finch waits for the umpire's raised finger but he knew what was occurring. Tried to tuck a fullish ball off his legs, bat turned in the hands and it ballooned up for a simple catch
full and around off stump to begin with to the new man, shuffles across and defends
nicely timed but his punch coming forwards rolls to the man at cover
on the stumps, good length and Warner tucks the ball towards midwicket, throw comes in as he returns to his crease
little bit of width, fired across the left-hander and Warner chops a couple through point
touch straight from Southee, this is flicked off the pads down to fine leg, where Vettori fields
timing from Warner, he;s going to be busy today, unless New Zealand can give him an early finish. Closes the face and punches a fullish ball back past the bowler
slightly full and outside the line of off, can't get this one away
pitched up, gets forward and dabs another quick single down the ground
angled in with the arm, Warner hops back and tucks another couple off his hips in front of square
slightly back of a length, over the stumps and Warner tries to hoick it to leg, hits the splice and falls towards short midwicket
full outside off, Warner is on the walk, spanks a lovely cover drive for the first boundary of the innings
sprays this towards leg stump but it just begins to come back at the batsman, stabbed to mid-on
pitched up on middle and leg, defended to the on side from back in the crease
length but veering towards leg, Boult striving a touch, you feel, Warner flicks it off his hips and they get three as Henry slides on the boundary at fine leg. Australia's dynamo keeps the strike
width, the ball isn't coming back in for Southee, Warner opens his shoulders and slaps another rasping drive through the covers
short now, kerplunked into the air... but it clears mid-on! Back-to-back boundaries for Warner, not the cleanest connection but it ran away

edged and wide of the sole catcher! What are the chances... no sooner as McCullum gone a touch more defensive, Southee draws an edge, Warner driving at a full ball, but it was out of reach of the diving Taylor
length delivery, punched into the off side for a quick single
outside off, shapes away, too far
goes across and is happy to leave a length ball outside off
straighter line, Smith works the ball off his pads for a single to midwicket
slips in the full ball on off, not quite a yorker, Smith is watchful enough to keep it out without drama
full and straight again, Smith reaches in front of his pad to check-drive back to mid-on
pitched up on the stumps and again Smith lines it up in defence
full and in the channel, shuffles across and mistimes a punch into the covers
put away! Boult drops short and Smith rocks back and dispatches this to the square leg boundary, lazy pull shot, in the old style
length in the channel, comes forward and drops one into a gap in front of square
flighted outside off, Smith skips out to it and drives firmly to mid-on
flatter and a touch straighter, stays on off stump and turns short to the on side
pushed through outside off stump and Smith sways back, guides a cut between two fielders, won't quite go all the way
tossed up on leg stump, Warner gets down late and shovels a sweep to backward square leg
flatter, quicker and again flicked around the corner to the man at 45
comes forward and taps this into the covers
goes around the wicket, digs this in short and Smith goes across to block on off stump
stroked through the covers, slightly full from Boult, the ball no longer moving and driven coming forwards
angled in, gets forward and taps one more in front of square
back over the wicket, good length and holding its line, defended in front of the wicket
drifts on to the pads and Warner clips between midwicket and mid-on for a single
around the wicket, length around the line of off, Smith gets in line

starts with a long hop and Warner has pulled this in the air, yards wide of Anderson at fine leg! Continues to throw the kitchen sink, this was top-edged but nearly went all the way, landed in front of the rope as the fielder realised he wasn't going to make it
pitched up and this time slapped hard into the covers, straight to the fielder otherwise that was four more
slighlty full, comes forward and pushes into the off side
full again, inviting the drive, punches this into the hands of short extra cover
Henry has found his line, pitched up a little further, blocked back towards the bowler
tight line on off stump, finishes the over well as Warner dabs towards short extra cover
length ball, around the line of off stump, goes back and across to defend
drops back in the crease and glides a single down to third man
overpitched and creamed through the covers, Warner is racing towards the line. Brings the hands through so fast, piercing the gap

misses this and struck on the back pad! Boult's arms goes up but he then realises it was probably sliding by... Dharmasena thinks the same. Warner fell over that delivery, heart would have been pounding for a moment
short and in the channel, sits back and uppercuts wide of third man, who gets around to cut it off
goes across and defends around the line of off
around the line of off, defended
sl;ightly back of a length, Smith blocks back to the bowler from in front of off
fuller length, shuffles across and pushes towards mid-on, they run one to the fielder
touch short and sliding across the left-hander, 140kph and blocked into the ground towards short extra cover
length on the stumps, punched into the ground and Henry grabs it in his follow through
continues around the line of off, decent pace from Henry, worked off the pads into a gap at midwicket
slightly short of a length, around the line of off, played into tthe ground
in the channel, tries to play from the crease but mistimes it, rolls back down the track
shortish and Warner is perilously close to playing on! Stayed back and hung out a horizontal bat, the thick bottom edge cannoned down wide of the stumps

half an appeal, again for lbw! Boult again thinks it was going down the leg side, no inside edge on the replay - Warner again stuck on the crease. Hawk-Eye suggests it would have shaved leg, umpire's call
drops back and dabs a length ball into the covers to steal one
fired across the right-hander from over the wicket, gets in line and defends with soft hands
cracked off the middle of the bat, Warner swats a short ball through square leg! Another boundary for the Warner dream-killing machine

back of a length and pulled again, another top edge - this time there's a man under it! McCullum sent a man back to deep square and Warner took on the challenge, his fire is doused and New Zealand have their second wicket. The ball was banged in, couldn't control the pull and Grant Elliott took a good, low catch running in
Henry continues to pound the pitch, Clarke walks across and stands tall to defend
tight line around off stump, covers his stumps and defends solidly
length in the channel, no deviation off the deck, Clarke blocks again
pitched up a little further, outside off but tailing back in dangerously. well judged by Clarke as he offer no shot
full and around off, shaping back a touch as Smith plays it moving across his stumps
length delivery on middle and off, tucked short into the leg side and they jog one
fired across the bows outside off, Clarke happy to watch that by as he gets comfortable in the middle
leading edge, flies through the covers, NZ hands on heads! The ball was sliding across Clarke and he closed the face on it, a low chance flew between the two men stationed there by B-Mac
bouncer from Boult, gets up sharply but Smith keeps on top of it and tucks one towards midwicket
fullish on off stump, Clarke drops his bat on it

he's hit the stumps but the bails have stayed on! To be honest, the ball only trickled on to the wicket but still... Smith played back to a length ball, got an inside edge on to his pads and then whirled around to see he was okay
goes across and defends solidly this time
on the stumps, length delivery, walks to the off side and tucks to leg
pitched up around the line of off, Clarke leans into a forward defensive
length around off stump, comes forward and taps into the covers
fullish, holding his line in the channel, Clarke again sits in his crease watchfully and blocks
slightly back of a length, Smith waits for it and tucks one more to leg
pitched up outside off, presses forward and pushes along the ground to mid-off
Clarke backs away and Southee fires it down wide of the stumps... called wide but that looked marginal
slams in a fiery bouncer, Clarke flinches as it climbs through - too high, this time
punched to the left of mid-on and Clarke gets off strike, he was hanging back and didn't hit it cleanly
fullish, shuffles across his stumps and defends
Southee pitches on a good length outside off, Smith gets in line and plays softly in front of square
in the corridor, slightly shorter, goes back and runs another single off the face down to third man
length ball around the line of off stump, Smith nonchalantly tucks it into the leg side for one more
pitched up in the channel outside off, Clarke is not being tempted by those yet
steams in and bangs the ball in very short, clearly they're trying to get Clarke a-swaying and a-creaking. Too high again, though
back of a length, over the stumps, defends form the crease
tight line around off stump, Clarke sits back and chops into the ground, rolls towards backward point
short and climbing at the batsman, better directed from Henry, Clarke squares up and presents his bat like a shield
on the stumps, played back with a closed face towards mid-on
goes around the wicket to change the angle, full length around off stump, Smith digs it out
Smiffy shuffles to the leg side, lights his pipe, tucks the morning paper under his arm and paddles one more through midwicket
back over the wicket, pitched up and blocked around off stump
fullish, width and Clarke bites this time, carves a thick outside edge high towards third man... No one out there, of course, and it bounces away to the rope
slips this is very full, homing on off stump, Clarke reacts quickly and manages to squeeze it out
drops short, nasty line of attack and Clarke half-pulls, half-jerks, sends the ball safely down and away through square for a couple
lovely stroke from Smith, fraction overpitched by Henry and he plants the front foot, picks a gap in the covers
Clarke on strike, so here's the short ball, drops back to defends
full and wide of the stumps this time, mistimes a drive coming forwards
flashes and flashes hard, a healthy top edge flies over the cordon, it was a bit too close to cut but he got away with it

another hair-raising boundary for Clarke, just beyond the fingertips of gully! Wasn't to the pitch but drove hard at a full ball in the channel, the edge whirred past the horizontal Williamson, I think, in an instant. Would have been another worldie but, then, we've come to expect them from NZ
short of a length, over the stumps, drops back and nurdles one to the leg side
tossed up on the stumps and pushed towards mid-on
gives this some air, dipping towards middle and leg, Smith uses his feet and whips the ball through square
length outside off, Clarke lets it come on to the bat, defends to short extra cover
tossed up and driven into the covers coming forwards
tight line from Vettori, little bit of drift in, Clarke again taps to short extra cover
looped towards leg stump, plenty of air, Clarke comes out to meet it and works one wide of mid-on
trundles in and whirs a full-length delivery on off stump, Clarke punches it back
length delivery, gets across and covers up his stumps in defence
not quite full enough to drive outside off, Clarke chops it into the ground and squeezes a single through point
short and rising past Smith's beak outside off, he leans back out of the way
straighter line and Smith tucks into his favourite scoring shot, glancing a length ball behind square - 100 up for Australia
slightly short and Clarke short-arms a pull towards mid-on, in the air for a bit and cut off on the bounce
flighted outside off, Smith winds up for a big hit, clubs it into the covers where a diving man cuts it off
pushed through a little quicker outside off, waits for it and pushes in front of square
chipped down the ground, Clarke on the walk, there's a man at long-on but it lands well in front of him
comes forward and tickles one more down the ground
tossed up outside off and driven along the ground to the extra cover fielder
outside off, tossed up quite high, leans into a punch that again finds cover
back of a length and pulled from off stump down to fine leg

slightly short again, pinged off the back foot through the covers and it looked like fourth boundary for Clarke, his first in front of square... but B-Mac hunts it down and dives to pull it in inches from the rope
continues to drop short, paddled away for another single to Smith
in the corridor, Clarke punches to the edge of the ring
similar line, slightly full and Clarke drives, can't get it through the infield again
if you can't go through 'em, try over 'em... full and straight and lofted authoritatively down the ground by Clarke, bottom-handed scoop to long-on for four
over the wicket, dug in very short and there are hoots from the crowd as wide is called
shortish and dabbed off the pads towards midwicket, they hustle one more
pitched up in the channel, leans into a drive and it's briefly aerial but wide of short extra cover, cut off out in the deep
goes across his stumps and defends a length ball back down the pitch
angled on middle and off stump, tucked away into a pocket behind square and Smith hurries back for a second
full, floaty wide yorker, Smith has to reach for it and McCullum cuts off the drive in the covers
tight line outside off, teasing length from Anderson but Smith calmly raises his bat out of the way
pushed through outside off, Clarke drops back and chops through backward point
waits in the crease and steers another single through square
tossed up, comes forward and plays along the ground to extra cover
flatter and worked off the pads through midwicket for a couple - Clarke overtakes Smith
six, lofted over long-off, Clarke is writing a nice little script for himself here... Skipped out and timed the ball down the ground, no slogging required
flat trajectory, around off stump, cut away for one more to the tally
around the wicket, back of a length, steered into the covers
slightly short and outside off, Clarke frees the arms but mistimes a cut into the ground, shakes his head
fuller, in the channel, punched to the short extra cover fielder
full again, enticing the drive, flies past the edge as Clarke has a go... looked for a moment like he'd nicked it, but no
gets across his stumps and defends into the off side

spanked! Touch full from Boult and Clarke stamps his mark on the final ball of the over, rattling a crisp on drive down the ground. It went at a catchable height but was closer to causing Richard Kettleborough a mischief than giving Boult a second wicket
tossed up, comes forward and pushes to long-on
busy in the crease now, moves across and whips a couple through square leg

tossed up and flicked off the pads for one more - that's Clarke's half-century, to the delight of the MCG. Started a bit sketchily but has shown class. Quick raise of the bat, then on we go, there's a job to do
driven in the air but short of mid-off diving forwards! Very difficult chance, couldn't get his hands under it
flat outside off, goes back and taps into the covers
pushed through in the channel again, chopped in front of square
Boult goes around the wicket, shortish and coming back in at the batsman, who defends square
back and across, back and across, back and across.. Smith nurdles one more to leg. Nurdling on into the sunset
short of a length and played the top of the bounce over off stump, down in front of point
quick, well-directed bumper, Clarke crouches as the ball flies over his back
back of a length and defended on the back foot around off stump
goes over the wicket, pitches on a length and raps Clarke on the knee roll, pitched outside leg, I think, runs away to backward point
back of a length outside off, hangs in the crease and chops a couple through point
short and wide and slashed fine of third man for four. Thick outside edge but Smith knew where it was headed, well wide of the lone slip
on the stumps, Smith goes across and miscues a pull through backward square for a couple
good length in the channel outside off, steps out and shoulders arms
full toss from Southee, veering towards leg stump, clipped away through square for one more
full toss again, maybe a slower one, Clarke doesn't time a bunt over mid-off but gets a couple
pitched up outside off, punched into the covers
in the channel outside off, drops back and steers one through backward point
fullish outside off, tapped towards short extra cover
lets go a fraction early and the attempted yorker becomes a full toss, Clarke leans out and casually slaps four through the covers
in the channel, fullish length, Clarke sits back and squeezes one more behind square
back over the wicket, fires in another attempted yorker, this one is on target and Smith nearly gets a leading edge back to the bowler. Not quite, though
full and straight, in the slot and Clarke carts it over wide long-on... well, not quite over, plenty of bottom-handed muscle in that but it bounces short of the rope
four more, low full toss whacked through the covers, zips past the man at short extra
length outside off, four more, sliced past point, flowing front-foot square drive from Clarke, he's charging towards the cup
four more, that's four in a row! Short and wide this time and Clarke dismissively rifles a cut away, it's all coming in a rush, six weeks of tension ebbing away
bangs this in short, sits back ready for it, paddles a single around the corner
fullish, outside off, Smith comes out to meet it but spanks a drive straight to mid-off
starts with a back-of-the-hand slower ball, drifts down the leg side

bowled him, Clarke has chopped on! He wont get to hit the winning runs but he will get a huge ovation from the MCG as he walks off for the last time in ODIs. He was trying to run one to third man, got an inside edge down on to the woodwork... Was that him wiping away something from his eye as he crossed the boundary rope?
drops back and defends a short-of-a-length delivery on the stumps
short again, drops deep and pulls one away through square
on the stumps, Smith whips a couple more past midwicket
fullish outside off, steers this behind point for two that takes him past fifty for the fifth time in the tournament. Smiffy's World Cup? Or Starc's?
goes across and defends on off stump
length ball around the line of off, Watson comes across and blocks lugubriously
continues to angled in from the channel, played to the leg side off his body
pitched up and driven wide of mid-on, there's a direct hit but Watson was safe
full length, almost the leg-stump yorker and Smith is defeated walking to the off side, slips narrowly past the wicket
excellent yorker from Southee, right on middle and off, Smith drops the bat on it in time
full again, dug out back past the bowler, mid-on busts a gut to get there and cuts it off, keep them to a single. Still two more required

short and pulled away with a whirl of those rubber wrists! There she blows, the winning runs fittingly from Smith's bat - Australia win the World Cup final by seven wickets, New Zealand were just swept aside in the end. Smith has been one of Australia's leading lights and he had guided them home at the G
